channel.title: Earthquakes on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Earthquakes on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: 2015 Graduation Day Galesburg MI earthquake rattles Ann Arbor, Grand Rapids, Detroit on May 2
item.description:
May 2, 2015, ANN ARBOR, MICHIGAN: A magnitude 4.0 earthquake rattled southern Michigan at 12:23 p.m. today, with the quake centered at Galesburg, MI. Timeline May 2, 2015, 12:59 p.m. EST: Official report gives the quake ID us20002avh. "Did you feel it" map shows the range of the affected area.
May 2, 2015, 12:37 p.m. EST: No official report yet from USGS, but an earthquake rattled the southern half of lower Michigan at about 12:25 p.

item.title: Did you feel it? M6.0 earthquake, 6km nw of American Canyon, Napa County CA
item.description: At 3:20 a.m. Pacific Time, an earthquake estimated at magnitude 6.0 struck near American Canyon, Napa County, California. The USGS event page says more. Scanner traffic: Napa County Fire (1300+ listeners), Vallejo Police and Fire (450+ listeners). As usual I found out about this event on Twitter. The hashtag #quake is trending.

item.title: Oklahoma earthquake, 7 December 2013 near Oklahoma City, OK - plus aftershocks
item.description:
A magnitude 4.5 earthquake hit near Edmond, Oklahoma (just north of Oklahoma City) at 12:10 p.m. local time on 7 December 2013. The "did you feel it" map is from the USGS:
In addition, on 8 December 2013 there were several aftershocks, including a magnitude 3.1 quake just after midnight local time. Previously: Oklahoma earthquakes, November 5-7 2011 and historical Reuters has a good overview of the Oklahoma earthquake situation in a November 11, 2013 article by Carey Gillam.

item.title: Earthquake, characteristic of North Korean nuclear testing, February 2013
item.description: As monitored from Seismic Network Operations, IC MDJ, Mudanjiang, Heilongjiang Province, China, this is an earthquake signature characteristic of nuclear testing. Or so that's the working assumption: North Korea is doing nuclear testing. What follows will be links, because I don't know any more about this than what I find out from the media. Nuclear Test Facility, Google Plus. This pinpoints the test facility, and gives its address as Nuclear Test Rd, North Hamgyong, North Korea.

item.title: Power outages follow Christchurch, New Zealand earthquake
item.description: Ann Arbor, December 22, 2011 - Three strong earthquakes of more than magnitude 5 hit Christchurch, New Zealand today, disrupting the power and telecommunications networks in the area and damaging roads and structures because of liquefaction of the soil. Damage and injury estimates are incomplete as of this writing. According to USGS, three earthquake hits christchurch today , 5.8 at 01:58:36 PM, 5.3 at 02:06:25 PM and 5.8 at 03:18:02 PM #eqnz
